content.description: Nice sandstone crack that may be slightly sandy.  Rock is soft but should not blow out if you fall on gear that is hand size.
content.protection: Use cams and nuts that look like they will fit in that size of crack.
content.location: Crack on the sandstone band to the east of the intersection of Nemo Road and Vanocer Canyon.  You can drive up on gravel until below the cliff.  Maybe a 10 minute walk.  We climbed it somewhere around 94/95. This doesn't really belong in the estes creek area but I did not remember how to start a new area.  Not too far from there though.

content.description: Drive .6 miles past Nemo toward Rapid City take a right on Estes Creek Road and follow to the top of the plateu.  Stay left at all of major intersections and park on top.  I believe it is about 2.9 miles from the highway to the top.  You can not see any rock where you park, but start exploring to the north, south, east, and west and you will find as many as 250 boulder problems on beautiful rock.  There are many crack problems and some short routes.  There are many pictures on this site of Estes Creek.  Much of the concentrated climbing is to the southeast from where you park.  Explore and have fun.
